title: <緊急法立法> 南華早報：香港將禁止抗議者戴口罩 違者恐入獄一年或罰款

replies.msg:
南華早報：香港將禁止抗議者戴口罩 違者恐入獄一年

2019-10-04

《南華早報》引述知情人士報導，香港計劃禁止在公眾集會上戴口罩或面具，否則可能面臨入獄一年或罰款港幣25,000元（約新台幣9.9萬元）。

報導說，香港政府將於今天（周五）公布此法令，新法令將明確闡明在抗議活動中禁止戴口罩的情形。

新規定不需要立法會的事先批准，並且只有在實施後才能修改或取消法律。

消息說，「這法律不會全面禁戴口罩，會有例外，像是因醫療因素配帶外科口罩。」
<聯合>

根據《簡易程序治罪條例》第22條，任何人如冒充公職人員，無論是否意圖取得有價值的東西，均觸違法。一經定罪，可罰款二千元（第一級罰款）或監禁六個月。

Here are some considerations :

"...The Phantoms are the latest iteration in privacy wear from Urban, whose 2016 Ghost frames (currently sold out) reflect both visible light and infrared light as a way to partially blind traditional flash photography and IR security cameras..."

"....And for the DIY’er, there’s an option for you too. Researchers at Carnegie Mellon University developed a 3D-printed pair of sunglasses that only cost $.22 to manufacture. The sunglasses, according to an accompanying study, fools advanced facial recognition software by altering small bits of color information in a face....."

Contact Carnegie Mellon University.

https://medium.com/tloveatl-codeworld/now-you-see-me-now-you-dont-sunglasses-and-facial-recognition-technology-4506b9dd8e1c

https://www.wbur.org/onpoint/2019/08/18/facial-recognition-trick-technology-hong-kong "..... researchers to explore ways to counteract it. One of them is Joey Bose, a computer engineering student at the University of Toronto.
